string-array.item: Composed in Vedic Sanskrit hymns, the texts constitute the oldest layer of Sanskrit literature and the oldest scriptures of Hinduism.
The Upanishads are a collection of Hindu texts which contain some of the central philosophical concepts of Hinduism.

refers to the collection of written descriptions of important events in Hinduism. It includes the Mahabharata, the Puranas and the Ramayana.
The Puranic literature is encyclopedic,[51] and it includes diverse topics such as cosmology, genealogies of gods, goddesses, kings, heroes, sages, pilgrimages, etc.
Shastra means "precept, rules, manual, compendium, book or treatise" in a general sense. Examples: Moksha-shastra, Artha-shastra, Nyaya-shastra, Yoga-shastra, etc.
